title: Rebrand to Bey Hub X, add customizable color scheme with dark/light mode, and set new logo

requirements.text: Update the website title and all user-facing references from 'The X' to 'Bey Hub X' across all frontend files including index.html, AppHeader.tsx, HomePage.tsx, and any other components displaying the site name

quotes: change the name to "Bey Hub X"

acceptanceCriteria: The browser tab title displays 'Bey Hub X'
The header navigation shows 'Bey Hub X' as the site name
The homepage hero section references 'Bey Hub X'
All meta tags and SEO references use 'Bey Hub X'

requirements.text: Implement a customizable color scheme system with support for dark mode, light mode, and user preference persistence. Use the existing OKLCH-based color system in index.css as the foundation and add a theme switcher UI component that allows users to toggle between modes

quotes: make a customizable color scheme with a dark mode, light mode, etc

acceptanceCriteria: A theme switcher component is accessible in the UI (e.g., in the header or settings)
Users can select between at least dark mode and light mode
The selected theme persists across browser sessions using localStorage
All existing UI components (buttons, cards, inputs, etc.) respond correctly to theme changes
The theme applies immediately without requiring a page reload

requirements.text: Replace the current site logo with the uploaded Beyblade X image (featuring a blue and silver beyblade with lime green X background). Display this logo in the application header (AppHeader.tsx) and any other locations where branding appears

quotes: make the logo the image PNG pasted

acceptanceCriteria: The new logo appears in the application header
The logo is responsive and scales appropriately on mobile devices
The logo maintains its aspect ratio and visual quality
The logo file is stored as a static asset in frontend/public/assets/generated/

constraints: Do not modify Internet Identity authentication components
Do not modify files in frontend/src/components/ui as they are read-only
Maintain the existing OKLCH-based color system structure
Preserve all existing functionality while adding theme switching capabilities
nonGoals: Adding additional theme options beyond dark and light mode in this iteration
Customizing individual color values per user
Adding animation effects to theme transitions
Changing the backend data models or API

required: Beyblade X logo with blue and silver beyblade on lime green X background (bey-hub-x-logo.dim_200x200.png)
